title: Bankless: Solana's Resilience and Prospects Amid Market Challenges - Blockchain.News
content:
Key Takeaways

Solana has recovered from a 93% market capitalization drop in 2022, showing a resurgence of ~111% year-to-date.

Priority fees and network upgrades have improved Solana's uptime to 100% in 2023.

The ecosystem is diversifying with new use-cases like compressed NFTs and AI initiatives.

Upcoming developments like Neon EVM and Solang could further bolster Solana's growth.

The Present: Overcoming Past Challenges

Network Status: Solana's network faced significant challenges in 2022, including a 93% drop in market capitalization and a 96% reduction in total value locked (TVL). However, the network has shown resilience in 2023. Priority fees and network upgrades have contributed to a consistent 100% uptime year-to-date. Approximately 42% of daily fees now come from users prioritizing their transactions, a trend expected to continue.

Ecosystem Highlights: The Solana DeFi ecosystem is recovering, with a 41% growth in TVL when denominated in USD. Liquid staking derivatives have also played a role in this resurgence. The ecosystem is diversifying into other sectors like NFTs, gaming, and consumer-oriented applications, driven by technological advancements like state compression.

The Future: A Bright Horizon

Several upcoming developments could further strengthen Solana's position:

Neon EVM: Went live in July, allowing Ethereum-based applications to operate on Solana.

Solang: A new compiler that enables Solidity-based projects on Solana.

AI Initiatives: A $10 million AI grant fund has been launched to expand into the AI sector.

Capital Injections: Solana is set to receive capital from recently launched growth initiatives like convertible grants, which transform into investments upon meeting specific milestones.

Conclusion

Solana has successfully navigated past challenges, emerging stronger in 2023. With a consistent 100% network uptime and diversification into new sectors, the future looks promising. Upcoming developments like Neon EVM, Solang, and AI initiatives could serve as catalysts for further growth.

Image source: Shutterstock

. . .

Tags

title: Reavers NFT Collection on Solana: The Next Big Thing in the Crypto-Art World? - Cryptocoin Spy
content:
The NFT world is buzzing with excitement, and the latest entrant to capture the collective imagination of the digital art enthusiasts is none other than the Reavers NFT Collection. Hosted on the increasingly popular Solana blockchain, this collection is not just another addition to the vast world of non-fungible tokens; it is a revolution in its own right.

Distinct Aesthetic Appeal

What sets Reavers apart from other NFT collections is its distinct artistic style that combines various genres like cyberpunk, fantasy, and surrealism to create an eclectic visual experience. Each Reaver is a unique piece of art, crafted with meticulous attention to detail and rich storytelling elements. This makes owning a Reaver not just a financial investment but also an emotional one, where collectors become custodians of a one-of-a-kind masterpiece.

Why Solana?

One might wonder why Reavers chose the Solana blockchain over the more established Ethereum platform. The answer lies in Solana’s impressive performance and low transaction fees. Given that each transaction in the NFT world includes minting, bidding, selling, and transferring tokens, the costs can quickly add up. Solana’s low fees make it an attractive platform for both creators and collectors. Additionally, Solana’s high throughput and fast transaction speed ensure that Reavers’ transactions are not just cheap but also quick.

Strong Community

Another remarkable feature of the Reavers collection is its active and engaged community. Reavers aren’t just digital art pieces; they are the lifeblood of an expanding universe built by its community. Frequent virtual events, AMA sessions with the creators, and active social media presence have helped build a sense of camaraderie among Reaver owners. And let’s not forget the lucrative staking opportunities and community governance aspects that give power back to the collectors.

Utility Beyond Art

Reavers are not just to be admired; they are to be utilized. Owning a Reaver grants you access to exclusive virtual worlds and metaverse platforms where your NFT can be used as an avatar or even as a gateway to unique experiences. Imagine entering a digital realm where your Reaver battles foes, embarks on quests, and earns rewards for you!

Environmental Concerns

Last but not least, the Reavers NFT Collection takes a responsible approach towards the environment. Solana’s Proof of History consensus algorithm is energy-efficient compared to the traditional Proof of Work algorithms. This means that your art collection is not just beautiful but also eco-friendly.

Conclusion

In an age where NFTs have been reduced to quick flips and speculation, the Reavers NFT Collection on Solana brings back the artistic essence and community spirit that drew people to this space in the first place. With its intricate designs, low fees, strong community engagement, and a focus on utility and sustainability, Reavers is setting a new standard in the NFT universe. If you haven’t checked out this groundbreaking collection yet, now is the time. Because Reavers are not just a fad; they are here to redefine the way we perceive art, ownership, and community in the digital age.

(This article is in no way financial advice – do your own due diligence before investing into a project)

title: Solana Announces Solana Permissioned Environments, Allowing Enterprises to Run Private VM Instances - CoinCodex
content:
Key takeaways

Solana (SOL) reveals customizable, geofenced blockchain solutions for enterprise-grade dApp development

Solana Permissioned Environments (SPEs) will enable full control over private VM instances while also delivering the same performance benefits of the Solana consensus protocol

SOL has outperformed the market during 2023, the algorithm predicts a re-test of the yearly high during a 64% upward move in the coming months

Solana introduces customizable blockchain environments for large-scale businesses

Solana Permissioned Environments (SPEs) will enable fully customizable blockchain solutions for businesses seeking to launch applications on the Solana network. A key feature of SPEs is that they will allow large-scale businesses to retain full control over a collection of geofenced nodes — this enables more incredible customizability while still retaining the underlying performance benefits of the Solana blockchain.

An increasing number of businesses around the world are seeking to launch blockchain-based services, with several high-profile brands already choosing Solana as their preferred blockchain network. Google, ASICS, and Visa have each expressed an interest in using Solana to differing degrees. Solana’s new SPE solution is designed to help such users launch their ideal blockchain application.

SPEs can provide benefits such as greater visibility over the protocol and more control over users. They use a private virtual machine that supports dApp development with both Solidity and Rust and also runs on the Solana consensus protocol that boasts sub-second block finality. One of the biggest benefits for enterprises is that transactions on the Solana network typically cost $0.00009735 each — significantly lower than most interchange fees.

Ultimately, Solana hopes its SPE solution will encourage more enterprises to adopt the blockchain as their decentralized network of choice. Solana has been designed with scalability in mind, and stated that SPEs “enable a category of products in the Solana ecosystem that combine the Solana protocol’s unparalleled technology with the high customizability required for large-scale businesses.”

The algorithm predicts a +64% move for SOL in the next 3 months

Despite bearish price action over recent years, including losing 92% of its value since forming an all-time high in November 2021, Solana (SOL) has outperformed the rest of the crypto market in 2023. Year-to-date, SOL has risen 95.68% while the total crypto market cap (TCAP) is just 34.98% up in the same timeframe.

Solana was one of the worst-performing cryptocurrencies in the aftermath of the FTX collapse in November 2022, with the price of SOL falling 67% in four days before eventually crashing below $10 for the first time since Q1 2021. Since then, however, the strong performance of SOL this year indicates strong demand for the token.

The CoinCodex algorithm expects SOL to re-test its yearly high within the next three months. SOL had reached its 2023 high of $32 in July before the recent retrace, and the algorithm has targeted a similar price level over the next 90 days. This would include a 64.62% move to the upside.

You can learn more about Solana’s recent price action and the network’s long-term potential by reading, Will Solana recover?

Bottom line

Solana aims to become the network of choice for enterprise-grade dApps. Solana is the best-performing blockchain in terms of transaction processing and also uses a virtual machine that enables more complex applications to be built within the ecosystem. Coupled with low gas fees and a token standard that is designed specifically for enterprise use, Solana is now well positioned to capitalize on the growing demand for decentralized services.

title: Understanding Zebec (ZBC): From Solana integration to the Nautilus Chain launch - OKX
content:
What would it take for financial transactions to flow in real-time without hiccups? One answer is Zebec (ZBC), Solana's groundbreaking decentralized finance (DeFi) solution. Zebec is considered a major player in defining how businesses transact, employees receive pay, and consumers make purchases by offering continuous, frictionless payment streams.

The protocol makes it easy for users to understand the complexities of DeFi. Are you curious about how Zebec could transform your financial experiences? Read on to find out.

What are Zebec and Nautilus Chain?

Zebec is an innovative continuous accounting protocol tailored for the DeFi landscape. It's revolutionized financial processes by automating the inflows and outflows of liquidity pools in the DeFi sector. At its core, Zebec streams stablecoin earnings directly into users' wallets, simplifying and accelerating the DeFi rewards experience.

Its token, ZBC, underpins this protocol, offering users a means of participating in its governance and utility.

In August 2023, Zebec launched Nautilus Chain — a technology that stands apart as the industry's first modular layer 3 chain. Inspired by Vitalik Buterin's layer 3 concept, Nautilus Chain paves the way for future blockchain architecture, targeting long-term disruptions in the public blockchain domain.

By integrating breakthrough technologies like zkRollup and leveraging Celestia as its foundational layer, Nautilus Chain provides unparalleled privacy and scalability. It surpasses traditional layer 1 networks, like Ethereum, by operating as a top parallel processing layer in the blockchain stack.

With Nautilus Chain, developers can seamlessly build independent decentralized app (DApp) chains, DApp rollups, and DApp subnets, maximizing scalability in the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) execution layer.

Zebec's continuous accounting protocol and Nautilus Chain's layer 3 technology offer a glimpse into the next evolutionary phase of the blockchain and DeFi sectors, driving efficiency, scalability, and user-centric solutions in Web3.

What are ZBC tokenomics?

$ZBC isn't just a utility token. It's pivotal for governance fee distribution and is designed to appreciate through deflationary mechanics. It's a cornerstone in the Zebec ecosystem, making sure of decentralization and community-driven growth.

Distribution and utility

Purpose: Initially designed as a utility token for Zebec protocol services.

Discounts: Holders can avail up to 25% off on payment streaming and Zebec's vault management system.

Rewards: The more $ZBC held, the higher the rewards on the Zebec Card.

Deflation mechanism

Zebec protocol: 50% of all fees are burned to manage the $ZBC price.

Nautilus Chain: 25% of all fees are burned as a deflationary mechanism, bolstering token value.

Governance and vote staking

Participation: $ZBC serves as a governance token, allowing holders to vote on proposals and influence the protocol's direction.

Staking mechanics: Predict the outcome of a proposal by staking $ZBC. Correct predictions earn stake returns and rewards, incorrect predictions give up their stake to the correct predictors.

Proposal prioritization: Proposals with the highest ratio of staked $ZBC (pass vs. fail) get priority, enabling the foundation to address the community's main concerns.

Usage on Nautilus Chain

Role: You can use $ZBC to pay all gas and transaction fees on the Nautilus Chain.

Fee allocation: Fees collected on Nautilus provide rewards for validators and support Zebec Foundation research. Meanwhile, half of these fees undergo burning.

How does Zebec revolutionize blockchain payments?

Zebec emerges as an innovator, particularly in streamlining payment processes. Central to Zebec's transformative approach is its Web3 flow payment technology. Rather than relying on traditional, discrete transaction methods, Zebec introduces a solution where payments flow continuously, reflecting real-time data streams.

Zebec's technology brings transformative implications for the world of modern finance:

Instantaneous transactions: By enabling speedy transactions, Zebec allows payments to be made instantly and without interruptions. This continuous stream reflects the Web3 ethos for uninterrupted and data-driven processes.

Capital efficiency: With Zebec's flow payment system, businesses can optimize their capital, enhancing liquidity. It offers better cash flow management and a more seamless user experience with faster and more consistent payments.

Decentralization and security: Drawing on the decentralized principles of Web3, Zebec upholds utmost transparency and security. The reduced need for intermediaries also means lower transaction fees and minimized delays.

Integration with Nautilus Chain: Zebec's collaboration with Nautilus Chain, especially with their launch of a significant ecosystem fund, illustrates the potential of combining advanced payment technologies with next-gen blockchain platforms.

Why Nautilus over other chains like Arbitrum or Optimism?

As you may know, numerous blockchain solutions are addressing the growing pains of scalability, security, and user experience. Nautilus Chain is a distinctive option in this context, particularly compared to platforms like Arbitrum or Optimism. Here's why:

Modularity

Nautilus Chain is the industry's first modular layer 3 chain.

Through its modular design, Nautilus delivers customizability, enabling developers to easily incorporate diverse features, therefore providing a more adaptable and forward-thinking platform.

Broad interoperability

Unlike chains reliant on layer 1 networks like Ethereum, Nautilus employs Celestia as its primary modular foundation.

Its design supports the creation of independent DApp chains, DApp rollups, and DApp subnets without reverting to a layer 1, streamlining development processes and providing efficient execution.

EVM-compatible environment

Nautilus presents the fastest EVM Rollup solution, backed by its modular architecture of Celestia + Eclipse + zkEVM.

This allows for higher scalability and capacity, delivering parallel processing and increased transaction throughput without compromising security.

Advanced privacy with zkRollup

Nautilus integrates zkRollup technology, which offers enhanced privacy features, safeguarding an individual's data and transactions.

Scalability

The combination of Celestia, Eclipse, and zkEVM sees Nautilus deliver an EVM environment with unmatched parallel processing capabilities.

With a measured TPS (transactions per second) of over 2,000 in an EVM environment during its testnet phase, Nautilus showcases superior scalability compared to many existing chains.

Strategic partnerships

Early collaborations with over 80 ecosystems, including prominent names like Celestia, Eclipse, and Poly Network, hint at Nautilus' commitment to building a comprehensive and robust blockchain ecosystem.

Nautilus Chain continues to excel at pushing boundaries regarding blockchain technologies. While platforms like Arbitrum and Optimism have their strengths, the unique benefits of Nautilus make it a compelling choice for those seeking a cutting-edge, EVM-compatible environment.

What's the impact of Zebec and Nautilus in Web3?

Zebec and Nautilus Chain stand out as major contributors to the Web3 ecosystem. Here are a few examples of how they're making an impact.

Zebec's role in modern finance

Revolutionizing payments: Zebec introduces a groundbreaking continuous-flow payment system. This Web3 flow payment technology dismantles the conventional one-time transaction model, introducing a dynamic where payments become as continuous as streaming.

Zebec's implications for Web2 business: Its unique flow payment technology holds vast potential for integration with Web2 businesses, especially in areas requiring real-time transactions. This includes employee salaries, utility payments, and subscription services. Additionally, their endeavor towards compliance-oriented solutions, such as KYC, paves the way for a smoother Web2-to-Web3 transition.

Nautilus Chain's distinct advantages

Pioneering layer 3 technology: As the industry's first modular layer 3 chain, Nautilus Chain is charting a path for future blockchain advancements. Its architecture is optimized for scalability, reporting a remarkable 2,000 TPS in EVM tests.

Enhancing interoperability: Unlike many chains that depend on layer 1 networks like Ethereum, Nautilus Chain operates on Celestia, giving it unparalleled flexibility. This allows for the creation of independent DApp chains and rollups, meaning developers aren't tied to layer 1 restrictions.

Scalable EVM experience: With integrating technologies like Celestia, Eclipse, and zkEVM, Nautilus Chain stands out as an EVM chain optimized for parallel processing. It offers an environment familiar to Ethereum developers and introduces unmatched speed and efficiency.

How are collaborations and partnerships shaping Nautilus Chain's future?

Nautilus Chain has taken the time to cultivate partnerships from DeFi to GameFi to set a foundation for a dynamic Web3 environment. The blockchain recognizes the value of collaborations and partnerships, and its alliances bridge many sectors in the blockchain ecosystem.

DeFi synergies

Nautilus Chain's association with Poseiswap and Coral Finance, early recipients of a substantial $20 million ecosystem fund launched with Zebec Labs, underscores its commitment to revolutionizing the DeFi space.

NFT and GameFi integration

By actively fostering relationships with diverse ecosystems, Nautilus Chain has primed its infrastructure for the booming NFT and GameFi sectors. This positions the blockchain as a preferred choice for emerging projects in these spheres.

Cross-chain bridges

Partnerships with ecosystems like Celestia, Eclipse, and Poly Network emphasize Nautilus Chain's focus on broad interoperability. Such collaborations fortify the blockchain's ambition of seamlessly connecting multiple blockchain networks.

Developer customization

Collaborative efforts enable Nautilus Chain to offer a variety of modules to developers, such as DApp chains and DApp rollups. This flexibility amplifies the potential for transformative advancements within the Nautilus Chain ecosystem.

What makes Nautilus Chain stand out?

Many believe that Nautilus Chain has emerged not just as another contender but an innovator, setting a new benchmark with its protocols.

Trailblazing layer 3 evolution

Following Vitalik Buterin's layer 3 concept, Nautilus Chain is pioneering the layer 3 frontier. This isn't just another layer — it's a foundation for future public blockchain development, profoundly influencing how public blockchains will evolve.

Stellar performance metrics

The testnet phase, including Triton, showcased a TPS of over 2,000 in an EVM environment, a testament to Nautilus Chain' robustness and efficiency.

Developer sovereignty

The Nautilus Developer platform offers modules such as DApp chains, DApp rollups, and DApp subnets. These reduce costs, enhance security, and allow the creation of new layers, fully independent of layer 1s like Ethereum.

Innovative interoperability

Nautilus Chain stands out with its permissionless interoperability via Hyperlane, enabling cross-chain messaging and composability without reverting to layer 1.

EVM redefined

Incorporating a modular stack with Celestia + Eclipse + zkEVM, Nautilus Chain is the fastest EVM Rollup solution, allowing parallel processing. This promises superior throughput, security, and the bonus of zkRollup technology for privacy.

Empowering community engagement

The NautDID system and Nautilus Dev Vault activity symbolize a concerted effort to actively engage the community, offering myriad benefits from token airdrops to participation in early projects, amplifying Nautilus Chain's user-centric ethos.

What's next for Zebec and Nautilus Chain?

DeFi constantly evolves, and Zebec and Nautilus Chain are at its forefront. Zebec's visionary Horizon Plan is emblematic of its forward-thinking approach. The plan aims to redefine how blockchain-based payments are conceptualized, bringing innovations that integrate seamlessly with the broader Web3 ecosystem.

A standout in this plan is the Zepoch node NFT, a novel concept that combines the collectible nature of NFTs with the operational prowess of blockchain nodes. This provides unique ownership rights and bridges the gap between digital art and functional blockchain components, a fusion not commonly seen in the crypto space.

Meanwhile, the Nautilus Chain has marked a significant milestone with the triumphant launch of its mainnet on August 19, 2023. As the first modular layer 3 chain, Nautilus Chain has set new standards in scalability and interoperability, especially with its groundbreaking TPS achievement in an EVM environment. Its successful mainnet debut reinforces its vision of building a thriving ecosystem that supports a broad spectrum of DApps.

The final word

Time is a powerful force in finance, and so real-time, seamless transactions are considered by many to be paramount to the payment ecosystem. Zebec stands apart as Solana's definitive payment solution, automating the flow of liquidity in the finance space.

Its token, ZBC, allows participants to engage in governance and utility actively. And, the Zebec-owned Nautilus Chain introduces a pioneering modular layer 3 chain that sets a foundation for new public blockchain developments in the future. Beyond traditional networks like Ethereum, it functions as a superior processing layer in the blockchain hierarchy, providing unmatched privacy and scalability.

Developers can effortlessly construct independent DApp configurations, leveraging maximum scalability in the EVM layer. As we move closer to the next phase of blockchain and finance, Zebec's accounting prowess and Nautilus Chain's advanced technology hint at a transformative future for Web3.

Now you're well-informed about Zebec, ZBC, and Nautilus Chain, take our quiz to earn ZBC.
